omt24cmt:
{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fmodern\fprq1\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}{\f1\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}{\f2\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\f0\fs20 General anesthesia and semi-lateral position.
\par Conventional drap with arm traction on flexion and sl. forward flexion was done.
\par 
\par Posterior viewing portal was done, Identified frayed labrum.
\par Synovectomy and labral debridement was done.
\par 
\par Same posterior viewing portal was made and identifed TOTAL teared SS and some anterior fray of CA ligament lemnant.
\par 
\par Debridement of subacromial bursa, acromioplasty with shavor and buur, arthrocare was done.
\par SS prep was done with punch scissors.
\par 
\par GT prep was done with shavor, arthrocare and burr, followed by #1 anchor 4.5mm screw inserted and all suture was passed with 4 strand suture material.
\par Puch lock anchor was inserted
\par 
\par Irrigation and debridement was done, followed by Hyal-anti adhesion material was injected.
\par 
\par skin suture and Abduction block brace was applied.
\par 
\par Suprascapular N. block was done at recovery room for pain control.
\par 
\par Described by MS LIM M.D
\par 
\par 
\par Dx.: RCT
\par 
\par \pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj TX.:Acromioplasty and RC repair #2 anchor\f1 
\par \pard\ltrpar\lang1042\f2\fs20 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx. : Fx. distal phalanx of 3rd finger, Rt. 
\par 
\par Postop Dx. :  same as above
\par                          
\par Op name :   C/R,I/F with K-wire (x2)
\par                                               
\par Procedures and Findings
\par 
\par  Under BPB anesthesia in the supine position
\par The routine orthopedic skin prep. and drape was applied.
\par The pneumatic tourniquet was applied in 290mmHg pressure.
\par Closed reduction was performed under C-arm guide.
\par One 1.4mm K-wire was inserted into distal phalanx of the 5th finger longitudinally.
\par Another one 1.2mm K-wire was inserted transversly.
\par A short arm splint was applied.
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}

\par

\par 
\par          
\par          Fx. site was comminuted.
\par         
\par          Under BPB anethesia in supine position,
\par         Closed reduction was performed under c-arm guide.
\par         Then two cross k-wires were inserted across thr Fx. line.
\par         Sugartong splint was applied.
\par }

omt24cmt:
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 \'b9\'d9\'c5\'c1;}{\f1\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 There were seen loose body in fibulotalar joint about 0.7x0.7cm
\par 
\par Under the spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed on the operating table in supine position. Skin drape and preparation were made on left lower leg area as usual manner. 15 pounds traction was applied for noninvasive distraction. Skin incision for anterolateral portal at 1cm at the level of the tibiotalar joint just medial to the peroneus tertius tendon was done with knife. For prevention of injury of the dorsal cutaneous nerve, the foot was placed platar flexing and inverting the foot to stretch the nerve. And then, a cannula was inserted with obturator. After removal of obturator, scope was introduced. Under arthroscopic transillumination, anterolateral portal was made at the joint level just lateral to the extensor hallucis tendon. A probe was inserted to anterlateral portal. Systemic examination of right ankle joint was performed. There were seen arthritic change of ankle and loose body in fibulotalar joint.\fs24 
\par \pard\qj\fs20 Arthroscopic debridement and irriagation were done with swan forcep, debrider and electric cauterization(VAPR). And arthroscopic loose body removal was done.\fs24 
\par \pard\fs20 And all instrument were removed. Wounds were closed. Dressing was applied. \f1\fs20 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 1. prone position
\par 
\par 2. C-arm guide \'c7\'cf\'bf\'a1 sacral hiatus lido 2% inj.
\par 
\par 3. \'c1\'b6\'bf\'b5\'c1\'a6 inj. \'c8\'ae\'c0\'ce
\par 
\par 4. inj ( lido + N/S + triam 10cc)
\par 
\par 5. dressing
\par 
\par 6 3\'bd\'c3\'b0\'a3 ABR
\par 
\par }

omt24codenm: Illizarov Distal Tibia c post. malleol
omt24cmt:
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx : 1) Fx, comminuted intra-articular, distal tibia, Rt.
\par            2) Fx. distal Fibula, Rt.
\par 
\par Postop Dx : the same as above
\par             
\par                           
\par Op name :   1) C/R, I/F & E/F
\par             2) C/R, IM nailing
\par                      
\par Procedures and Findings
\par              Supine position under spinal anesthesia
\par              1) One cancellous screw was inserted to fix the intra articular Fx of distal 
\par                 fragment. Under C-arm guide the Fx site of distal tibia was reduced. Maintaing       
\par                 the reduction, Illizarov syatem was fixed proximally 2 rings at tibia shaft, 
\par                 distally one ring at distal tibia and two 5/8 rings calcaneus and metatarsal 
\par                 bones respectively. 
\par               2) Under C-arm guide an entry for Rush pin was made at distal fibula. Reducing 
\par                 the Fx site of the fibula closely, a Rush pin was inserted from tip of distal 
\par                 fibula.   
\par \pard\fs20 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx. :  Fx. lat. malleolus ankle Rt.
\par             
\par Postop Dx. :  same as above
\par                                       
\par op name :   OR/IF lat. malleolus
\par 
\par Anesthesia : Spinal Ane. 
\par                                        
\par                        
\par Procedures and Findings
\par 
\par        findings :   
\par        short oblique fx. of lat. malleolus
\par       
\par          Under spinal anesthesia, the patient was laid with supine position on the op. table. 
\par         The routine orthopedic skin prep. and drape was done.
\par         The pneumatic tourniquet was applied with 270 mmHg.
\par         Skin incision was done at lateral malleolus longitudinally.
\par         Fx site was exposed in ruotine manuver. Keeping the reduction with reduction forceps 
\par         a 7 hole1/3 tubular plate was fixed.
\par         Subcutaneous tissue and skin were close in usual fashion.
\par         Compressing dressing and long leg splint was done.
\par 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx. :  Comm. Fx.5th metatarsal foot Lt. 
\par Postop Dx. : the same as above
\par                           
\par Op name :    OR/IF
\par 
\par Procedures and Findings         
\par        
\par            under spinal anesthesia  in the supine position
\par           The routine orthopedic skin prep. and drape was done.
\par           The pneumatic tourniquet was applied with 260mmHg.
\par           Shaft Fx. ->  OR/IF c one K-wire and wire banding
\par           Jone"s Fx ->  OR/IF c two K-wires and tension banding
\par           Short leg splint was applied.
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx. :  Fx, clavicle, right
\par             
\par Postop Dx. : Comm. Fx, Clavicle, right 
\par                           
\par op name :   OR + IF
\par                                        
\par Anesthesia : general anesthesia
\par                        
\par Procedures and Findings
\par 
\par        findings : comm. Fx at lateral 1/3 area
\par   
\par         Under general anesthesia routine drapping
\par         Three 1.8mm K-wires were inserted intramedullary and fixed through both cortex.
\par         Bone fragments -> chip bones -> Bone graft
\par         Op wd was closed in usual fashion.     
\par         Drain(+), Velpeau Bandage.\fs20 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx :   Fx femur neck Rt.
\par 
\par Postop Dx :  same as above
\par             
\par                           
\par op name :    C/R ,multiple pinning with cannulated screw.x3 ---81.52
\par 
\par Procedures and Findings
\par 
\par          
\par           Under spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed on the fracture table. 
\par           Traction and closed reduction were made under c-arm guide.
\par           Routine orthopaedic skin drap was done.
\par           Three cannulated cancellous screws were inserted into femur neck, one superior   
\par           centeral, another inferior anterior and the other screw inferior posterior portion 
\par           of femur neck. After insertion of hemovac tube skin & subcutaneous tissues were 
\par           closed in usual fashion.
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx : Fx, scaphoid, Rt.
\par 
\par Postop Dx. :  same as above
\par                                       
\par op name :   OR/IF 
\par 
\par Anesthesia : BPB 
\par                                        
\par                        
\par Procedures and Findings
\par 
\par          Under BPB anesthesia, the patient was laid with supine position on the op. table. 
\par         The routine orthopedic skin prep. and drape was done.
\par         The pneumatic tourniquet was applied with 240 mmHg.
\par         Dorsal approach. 20mm miniaccutreck screw was inserted following guide pin under C-arm         guide.
\par         Subcutaneous tissue and skin were close in usual fashion.
\par         Thumb splint was applied.
\par 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20        
\par        intaraarticular type (subtalar joint involving) 
\par 
\par         Under spinal anesthesia, the patient was laid with supine position on the op. table. 
\par         The routine orthopedic skin prep. and drape was done.
\par         The pneumatic tourniquet was applied with 270 mmHg.
\par         After subtalar reduction using C-arm , 3 cannulated screws was inserted transversly.
\par         Using Essex-Lopresti method, K-wire fixation was inserted.
\par         Subcutaneous and skin suture was done.
\par         Compressing dressing and long leg splint was done.
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx. :    O.A. knee, Rt.  
\par 
\par Postop Dx. : the same as above
\par                           
\par Op name :    Arthroscopic exam.. & synovectomy
\par 
\par Anesthesia : Spinal Aneshtesia
\par 
\par                                      
\par Procedures and Findings         
\par     
\par     Findings ;   
\par     Articular cartilage of medial femoral condyle was denuded.
\par     Degenerative change of med. meniscus knee Lt.
\par                              
\par                              
\par      Under spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed on the op. table with supine position. 
\par      The pneumatic tourniquet was applied with 270 mmHg.
\par      The anterolateral portal was made for scope and antermedial portal for shaver and probe.
\par      There was degenerative changes in the Med. meniscus.
\par      ACL and PCL was intact.
\par      After irrigation, the portal wounds were closed.
\par      1% lidocain 5cc and one hyruan plus were injected into knee joint.
\par      Compression dressing was applied.
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop Dx :  Septic Arthritis , Rt.knee  ---  M00.9
\par 
\par Postop Dx : the same as above
\par             
\par                           
\par op name :     Arthroscopic irrigation 
\par                and Synovectomy
\par                      
\par Procedures and Findings
\par 
\par      The knee joint was filled with prulent thick joint fluid(pus).
\par     inflammatary granulation tissue was found at all around joint capsule.
\par                         
\par                              
\par      Under spinal anesthesia, the patient was placed in supine position on the op. table.
\par      The pneumatic tourniquet was applied with 270 mmHg.
\par       anterolateral portal was made for scope and anteromedial portal for shaver and probe.
\par       At first, suprapatellar pouch was seen, and inflammatary granulation tissues was seen.
\par       then downward along the  medial femoral condyle to medial condyle of tibial  plateau.
\par       The scope was directed laterally ACL and to lateral meniscus in figure of four position. 
\par       The inflammatory synoviums were removed by shaver and the joint was irrigated c saline.
\par       A hemovac tube was inserted and the Op. wd were closed in usual fashion.
\par       Long leg splint was applied.
\par 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 reop Dx. :  Tear, Med. meniscus, knee, Rt.
\par 
\par Postop Dx. : same as above
\par                            
\par Op name :    Arthroscopic meniscectomy and synocvectomy
\par 
\par Anesthesia : spinal anesthesia
\par                                      
\par Procedures and Findings         
\par     
\par     Findings ;   
\par       bucket hanle type tearing, posterior to mid horn, med. meniscus                             
\par                              
\par       Under general anesthesia, the patient was laid on the op. table with supine position. 
\par      The pneumatic tourniquet was applied with 270 mmHg.
\par      The anterolateral portal was made for scope and antermedial portal for shaver and probe.
\par      ACL and PCL was intact.
\par      Hypertrophied synovium was removed byshaver.
\par      After cutting the attaches to post. and mid horn, the torn part of meniscus was removed 
\par      in one piece. 
\par      After irrigation, the portal wounds were closed.
\par      1% lidocain 5cc was injected into knee joint.
\par      Compression dressing was applied.
\par }

\par Procedures and Findings
\par 
\par     Under the spinal anesthesia, the patient was laid with supine position.
\par     The routine orthopedic skin prep and drap was applied.
\par     Pneumatic tourniquet was applied at 270mmHg.
\par     skin incision was done at medial side of Gt toe MP joint and bunionectomy was performed.

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop DX :  HIVD L4-5, Lt.
\par 
\par Postop Dx : same as above
\par                          
\par Op. name :  Open Discectomy L4-5,Lt
\par                                      
\par Anesthesia : general anesthesia    
\par 
\par Procedures and Findings  
\par 
\par 
\par      findings : sublig. type
\par                        
\par        
\par       Under general anesthesia, the patient was drapped in prone position.
\par      C-arm was taken to determine the level of dissection. 
\par      For bleeding control dilluted Epinephrin(1:200,000)was injected around incision site.   
\par      A straight midline incision was made over L5-S1 inter space. 
\par      Dissection was continued between spinous process and paravertebral muscles in both 
\par      sides. The fascia and muscles were stripped subperiosteally from spinous process and 
\par      lamina. The lower edge of ligamentum flavum was dettached from the lamina by curets 
\par      and Kerrision rongeur. Total Lig/ flavum and parts of Lamina were removed.
\par      Herniated disc materials were removed.
\par      After irrigation and debridement, hemovac tube was inserted and 
\par      the Op. field was closed in usal fashion.
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop DX :  Spinal stenosis L2-3.3-4
\par             
\par Postop Dx : same as above
\par             
\par                           
\par Op. name :   Minimal decompression with discectomy L2-3,Rt
\par                                                    L3-4,both
\par                                                   
\par Procedures and Findings  
\par 
\par       
\par       Under general anesthesia, the patient was drapped in prone position.
\par      Roentgenograms was taken to determine the level of dissection. 
\par      For bleeding control dilluted Epinephrin(1:200,000)was injected around incision site.   
\par      A straight midline incision was made. 
\par      Dissection was continued between spinous process and paravertebral muscles in both 
\par      sides. The fascia and muscles were stripped subperiosteally from spinous process and 
\par      lamina. The lower edge of ligamentum flavum was dettached from the lamina by curets 
\par      and Kerrision rongeur. Total Lig/ flavum and parts of Lamina were removed.
\par      Dicectomy was performed L3-4.
\par      At op. finding .ligamentum flavum & facet joint were hypertrophied.
\par       The decompressed condition of lateral recess and intervertebral foramen were 
\par      confirmed by probing with Penfield dissector.
\par       After irrigation and debridement, hemovac tube was inserted and 
\par      the Op. field was closed in usal fashion.
\par 
\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg949\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1042{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset129 \'b1\'bc\'b8\'b2\'c3\'bc;}}
\viewkind4\uc1\pard\lang1042\f0\fs20 Preop DX :  Spinal stenosis L4-5 both --- M48.0
\par             Instability L4-5
\par 
\par Postop Dx : the same as above
\par             
\par                           
\par Op. name :   Minimal decompression L4-5 both  --- 03.09
\par              PLIF (solco)
\par                                      
\par Procedures and Findings  
\par 
\par 
\par      findings : central stenosis
\par                 with severe HIVD        
\par        
\par      Under general anesthesia, the patient was drapped in prone position.
\par      Roentgenograms was taken to determine the level of dissection. 
\par      For bleeding control dilluted Epinephrin(1:200,000)was injected around incision site.   
\par      A straight midline incision was made over L5-S1 inter space. 
\par      Dissection was continued between spinous process and paravertebral muscles in both 
\par      sides. The fascia and muscles were stripped subperiosteally from spinous process and 
\par      lamina. The lower edge of ligamentum flavum was dettached from the lamina by curets 
\par      and Kerrision rongeur. Total Lig/ flavum and parts of Lamina were removed.
\par      At op. finding .ligamentum flavum & facet joint were hypertrophied.
\par       The decompressed condition of lateral recess and intervertebral foramen were 
\par      confirmed by probing with Penfield dissector.
\par      Pedicle screw system (6.5x40mmx2, 6.5x45mmx2, 50mm rods) and two 10mm Cages c bone 
\par      graft were inserted. After irrigation and debridement, hemovac tube was inserted and 
\par      the Op. field was closed in usal fashion.
\par 
\par }
